name: College Football Stadiums 2005 Quiz | Sports | 20 Questions

questions.text: Which stadium had the largest capacity of any NCAA facility in the 2005 season?
questions.explanation:
Michigan Stadium.

	The home of the Michigan Wolverines, in Ann Arbor, had a capacity of 107,501.

questions.text: Which Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC) college played at Carter-Finley stadium?
questions.explanation:
North Carolina State.

	Carter-Finley Stadium, in Raleigh, had a capacity of 51,500.

questions.text: Which stadium was selected to host the Florida-Georgia game in 2005?
questions.explanation:
All-Tel Stadium.

	The home of the Jacksonville Jaguars was the traditional neutral venue for the annual match-up of the Florida Gators and Georgia Bulldogs.

questions.text: Which Big East college played at the Carrier Dome?
questions.explanation:
Syracuse.

	The home of the Syracuse Orange had a cpacity of 49,550.

questions.text: What nickname was shared by the colleges who play at Commonwealth Stadium, Wagner Field, and Ryan Field?
questions.explanation:
Wildcats.

	Commonwealth Stadium in Lexington was home to the University of Kentucky; Wagner Field in Manhattan was home to Kansas State University; Ryan Field in Evanston was home to Northwestern University.  All these schools were nicknamed "Wildcats".

questions.text: Which college shared The Coliseum with the Tennessee Titans of the NFL?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee State.

	The Coliseum in Nashville, built for the Tennessee Titans, was also home to the Tennessee State Tigers of the Ohio Valley Conference.

questions.text: What was the name of the stadium that was home to Notre Dame?
questions.explanation:
Notre Dame Stadium.

	Notre Dame Stadium in South Bend, Indiana, had a capacity of 80,795.

questions.text: Which Pac 10 college played at Martin Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Washington State.

	Martin Stadium, in Pullman, had a capacity of 37,600.

questions.text: What name was shared by the stadiums used by the universities of Illinois, Indiana, California, and Kansas?
questions.explanation:
Memorial Stadium.

	Memorial Stadium was the most common name for stadiums in Division 1-A football. As well as the four colleges mentioned, Memorial Stadium was also the name of the homes of the Universities of Nebraska, Clemson, and Troy State.

questions.text: Which Mountain West college played at LaVell Edwards Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Brigham Young.

	The home of the Brigham Young Cougars, in Provo, was originally named Cougar Stadium, but was later renamed in honour of legendary coach LaVell Edwards.

questions.text: What was the name of the stadium that was home to the University of Alabama?
questions.explanation:
Bryant-Denny Stadium.

	Bryant-Denny Stadium, in Tuscaloosa, had a capacity of 83,818.

questions.text: Which Ivy League team played at Lawrence A. Wien Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Columbia.

	The home of the Columbia Lions, in New York City, had a capacity of 17,000.

questions.text: Which stadium was selected to be the venue for the game between Oklahoma and Texas in 2005?
questions.explanation:
Cotton Bowl.

	The Cotton Bowl, in Dallas, was the traditional neutral venue for the match-up between the Oklahoma Sooners and Texas Longhorns.

questions.text: Which Conference USA team played at Gerald Ford Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Southern Methodist.

	The home of the SMU Mustangs, in Dallas, had a capacity of 32,000.

questions.text: Which Southeast Conference (SEC) college played at Neyland Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee.

	Neyland Stadium, in Knoxville, had a capacity of 104,079.

questions.text: Which Mid-American Conference team played at the Glass Bowl?
questions.explanation:
Toledo.

	The Glass Bowl had a capacity of 26,248.

questions.text: Which Big 12 team played at Jack Trice Field?
questions.explanation:
Iowa State.

	Jack Trice Field, in Ames, had a capacity of 45,814.

questions.text: Which college shared Lincoln Financial Field with the Philadelphia Eagles of the NFL?
questions.explanation:
Temple.

	The Temple Owls shared Veterans Stadium with the Eagles for many years, and moved into the new Lincoln Financial Field with them in 2003.

questions.text: Which Big 10 team played at Ross-Ade Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Purdue.

	The home of the Purdue Boilermakers, in West Lafayette, Indiana, had a capacity of 62,500.

questions.text: Which Western Athletic Conference (WAC) team played at Dick Romney Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Utah State.

	The home of the Utah State Aggies, in Logan, had a capacity of 30,257.
